definitions.title: n.f.
definitions.body: :1Ki 8:54 hollow, or flat of the hand, palm, sole of foot, pan (NH id.; Aram. id., kapo0 As. kappu, hand, pan, kippatu, hollow; Ar. kaf=un palm, hand)—abs. ´[[כ]] Job 29:9 + , so rd. prob. also Ez Eze 29:7 b for MT [[כָּתֵף]] (LXX SyrVer Sm Co, cf. v:a); [[כָָּף]] 2Ki 11:12 + ; more oft. cstr. [[כַּף]] Ge 40:11 + ; sf. [[כַּפִּי]] Ju Jdg 12:3, [[כַּפְְּ]] Job 13:31, etc.; in Ez Eze 29:7 rd. [[כַּף]] Qr for [[כפך]] Kt (so Ew Hi Sm Co Da); du. [[כַּפַּיִם]] Is 49:16 + ; cstr. [[כַּפֵּי]] Ex 29:24, Ex 29:24 + 3 t. ; sf. [[כַּפַּי]] Ge 20:5 + , [[כַּפָּיו]] Nu 24:10 + , [[כַּפֵּיהֶם]] Is 59:6 + 2 t., [[כַּפֵּימוֹ]] Job 27:23, etc.; pl. [[כַּפּוֹת]] (esp. of soles, and in metaph. senses) abs. Nu 4:7 + ; cstr. 2Ki 9:35 + , sf. [[כַּפׂתָיו]] Ex 25:29, Ex 37:16; —

definitions.title: 1. a.
definitions.body: of human beings, hollow or flat of hand, palm, (c. 116 t.) 2Ki 4:34, 2Ki 4:34; ´[[נׇתַן אֵת הַכּוס עַלכּכַּף פ]] Ge 40:11, Ge 40:21 (E), set the cup upon the palm of Pharaoh (cf. v:Ge 40:11 [[וְכוֹס פַּרְעׂה בְּיָדִי]]), similarly Le 8:27, Le 8:27 (P) + ; [[הַשֶּׁמֶן אֲשֶׁר עַלכּכַּפּוֹ]] Le 14:16, Le 14:17, Le 14:18, Le 14:27, Le 14:28; as disting. from wrist and arm, De 25:12; rarely c. [[ידים]] (always [[כַּכּוֹת]]), [[שְׁתֵּי כַּפּוֹת ידיו]] 1Sa 5:4 (of Dagon), [[הַיׇּדַיִם]] ´[[כ]] 2Ki 9:35, cf. Da 10:10; [[כַּף הַשְּׂמָאלִית]] Le 14:15, Le 14:26; note esp. [[קֶמַח]] ´[[מְלאׁ כ]] 1Ki 17:12 a handful of meal (lit. palmful), cf. Ec 4:6 (where disting. fr. [[מלא חָפְנַיִם]] a double fistful; in both these passages of a very small quantity); cf. [[וַיְמַלֵּא כַּפּוֹ מִן]] Le 9:17 (ref. to [[מְלאׁ קֻמְחוֹ]] Le 2:2, Le 5:12 cf. Le 6:8). In Ex 4:4 (JE), Pr 31:19, Ez Eze 21:16, Ps 129:7, etc., the thought is that of grasping.

definitions.title: b.
definitions.body: anthropomorph. of ´[[י]] covering Moses over with his palm, [[וְשַׂכּׂתִי כַפִּי עָלֶיְ]] Ex 33:22 (J), and so fig. (c. [[שׁית]]) Ps 139:5; withdrawing ([[הֵסִיר]] ) his hand Ex 33:23 (J); removing ([[הִרְהִּיק ]] ) his afficting hand Job 13:21; [[עַלכּכַּפַּיִם כִּסָּה אוֹר]] Job 36:32, i.e. he (God) hath filled his palms with light.

definitions.title: c.
definitions.body: once of animals, [[הוֹלֵח עַלכּכַּפָּיו]] Le 11:27 going upon their palms, i.e. paws (cats, dogs, etc.).

definitions.title: d.
definitions.body: phrases are:—† (I) [[הִכָּה כַּף]] = clap the hands, in applause 2Ki 11:12 so ´[[תָּקַע כ]] Ps 47:2, ´[[מָחָא כ]] Is 55:12 (fig. of trees), Ps 98:8 (fig. of rivers); but esp. in scorn, contempt, etc., [[סָפַק אֶת־כַּפָּיו]] Nu 24:10 (J), [[יִשְׂפּׂק עָלֵימוֹ כַפֵָּימוֹ]] Job 27:23; so [[תָּקַע כַּף על־]] Na 3:19, [[הִכָּה כַפִּי אֶל־]] Ez Eze 22:13 (of ´[[י]]); abs., [[בְכַפְּ ְהִכָּה]] Ez Eze 6:11 (as [[מחא יד]] Eze 25:6), [[הִכָּה כַּף אֶל־כַּף]] Eze 21:19, [[אַכֶּה כַפִּי אֶל־כַּפִּי]] v:Eze 21:22 (of ´[[י]]). † (2) [[תָּפַשׂ בַּכַּף]] grasp, seize with the hand Ez Eze 29:7 cf. v:Eze 29:7 (on text v. supr.) † (3) of hand-grasp as pledge [[לַזָּר כַּפֶּי ְתָּקַעֲתָ]] Pr 6:1 (if) thou hast smitten thy palms (given a double hand-grasp), for another (so De; ‖[[עָרַבְתָּ לְרֵעְֶָ]]); so abs. [[תקע כף]] Pr 17:18, Pr 22:26 (cf. [[תקע ליד]] Job 17:3). (4) oft. of hand spread out in prayer, as sign of longing to receive, c. [[פָּרַשׂ ־ֶ]] Ex 9:29, Ex 9:33 (J), 1Ki 8:38 = 2Ch 6:29, etc. (v. [[יד]] Ps 143:6, La 1:17 and [[יׇד]]

definitions.body: supr. p. 389; also [[פרשׂ]], [[נאשׂ]], [[שׁטח]]). † (5) [[שׂים כַּף לְפֶה]], in respectful silence, Job 29:9. † (6) fig. [[בְכַפִּיוׇאָשִׂימָה נַפְשִׁי]] Ju Jdg 12:3 = I have taken my life in my hand (i.e. hazarded it), so 1Sa 19:5, 1Sa 28:21, Job 13:14 and (without vb.) Ps 119:109. † (7) ´[[נִקְיׁן כ]] Ge 20:5 cleanness of palms is fig. for purity of act, cf. Ps 26:6, also Job 9:30, Job 22:30, Ps 24:4, Ps 73:13; conversely, [[חָמָס בְּכַפָָּי]] ([[לאׁ ]] ) Job 16:17, 1Ch 12:18, Is 59:6, Jon 3:8, cf. Is 59:3 (so [[ידים]] Is 1:15), Job 31:7, Ps 7:4.—In many cases [[כַּף]] is not to be distinguished from [[יׇד]]; so in phr. † ´[[יְגִיעַ כ]] toil of the hands Ge 31:42, Hag 1:11, Job 10:3, Ps 128:2; ´[[פּׂעַל כ]] Ps 9:17, ´[[חֵפֶץ כ]] Pr 31:13; ´[[תְּבוּנוֹת כ]] Ps 78:72, ´[[פְּרִי כ]] Pr 31:16 †; cf. Mic 7:3. †

= power (i.e. grasp) of any one, [[נתן בכף]] Ju Jdg 6:13 = deliver into the power of, so Je 12:7, cf. [[בּוֹא בכף]] Pr 6:3; usu. [[הוֹשִׁיעַ]], [[פּדָה]], [[הִצִּיל]] etc., c. [[יָד]]

[[רַגְלָהּכַּף]], etc., = sole of foot, Ge 8:9 (J), Jos 3:13, Jos 4:18 (both JE), 1Ki 5:17, 2Ki 19:24 = Is 37:25, De 11:24, De 28:56, De 28:65, Jos 1:3 (D) Ez Eze 43:7, Mal 3:21; [[קָדְקֳדוֹמִכַּף רַגְלוֹ וְעַד]] 2Sa 14:25, Job 2:7, cf. Is 1:6 (fig.); ´[[ר]] ´[[מִדְרַח כ]] De 2:5 treading-place for the sole of a foot; of the cherubim Ez Eze 1:7, of a calf, (in sim.) v:Eze 1:7., (acc. to MT; cf. however Co).
of various hollow, bending or bent objects:—†

definitions.title: a.
definitions.body: hollow (i.e. socket), of the thigh-joint, [[יׇרֵח]] ´[[כ]] Ge 32:26, Ge 32:26, Ge 32:32, Ge 32:32 (J).

definitions.title: b.
definitions.body: pan, vessel (as hollow), used in ritual, Ex 25:29, Ex 37:16, Nu 5:7, Nu 7:14 + 15 t. Nu 7; 1Ki 7:50 = 2Ch 4:22, 2Ki 25:14 = Je 52:18, Je 52:19, 2Ch 24:14. †

definitions.title: d.
definitions.body: [[כַּפּוֹת תְּמָרִים]] Le 23:40 = of huge hand-shaped branches (or fronds) of palm-trees.

definitions.title: e.
definitions.body: [[כַּפּוֹת הַמַּנְעוּל]] Ct So 5:5 the (bent) handles of the bolt.
